comments.body: how spammy are these logs? will it be annoying to dump them even in success conditions?
Does getPodLogs shell out to kubectl? That's the point of this test...
No, it doesn't, but the point of these tests is to test that `kubectl port-forward` works. I don't think how the logs are retrieved really matters... do you?

Sorry, didn't notice that this was in the port forward suite, not the
kubectl suite!
On Feb 20, 2016 4:46 AM, "Andy Goldstein" notifications@github.com wrote:

> In test/e2e/portforward.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/21602#discussion_r53549876
> :
> 
> > @@ -195,7 +187,16 @@ var _ = Describe("Port forwarding", func() {
> >                 Failf("Expected %q from server, got %q", e, a)
> >             }
> > -           logOutput := runKubectlWithTimeout(wait.ForeverTestTimeout, "logs", fmt.Sprintf("--namespace=%v", framework.Namespace.Name), "-f", podName)
> > -           By("Waiting for the target pod to stop running")
> > -           framework.WaitForPodNoLongerRunning(pod.Name)
> >   +
> > -           By("Retrieving logs from the target pod")
> > -           logOutput, err := getPodLogs(framework.Client, framework.Namespace.Name, pod.Name, "portforwardtester")
> 
> No, it doesn't, but the point of these tests is to test that kubectl
> port-forward works. I don't think how the logs are retrieved really
> matters... do you?
> 
> â€”

				Failf("Error retrieving logs: %v", err)
